website_summaries.verdict: Advanced zoom capabilities, which is especially convenient for those shooting wildlife or vacation pictures.
pros: Making it a great option for travel or transport, the CoolPix can deliver crisp photos with an 83x optical zoom (the most of any other CoolPix so far)
Users love the flexibility of the features, as well as the DSLR styling
Many experienced photographers choose this model as their more basic option when they don't want to pack more gear
cons: Pricy for a point-and-shoot camera, but users love the results

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST camera I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST camera I have ever owned. We were at the Arches National Park. I shot a picture of the full moon that night and had to zoom out a little to get the entire moon. The zoom is just so fantastic on this thing. From a tiny spider to a moon. The night pictures are as great as the daytime pictures. It's clarity is wonderful also. My camera friends are jealous because they have to whip out all of their lenses where I just zoom and shoot. If I could give this a 10 star, I would!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: So far so great!
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality, ease of use, and the zoom is sick!! So many peeps ask me how $$$$ it is... the zoom alone is so worth it. You can also turn on the wifi on cam and use the nikon app to take pictures remotely, and zoom in and out focus remotely. Also can transfer pix to your phone ipad while out on location and then upload them to Facebook or Instagram from your device! So cool. These pics are the proof of the crazy amazing zoom. Still have yet to try with tripod. the circled bits are where the next pic is fully zoomed in on. amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: NYC guy

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS CAMERA ! I was looking for a zoom camera which would be easy to carry with me hiking and I scored with this purchase. It is light enough not to be a burden to carry and does everything I could hope for ( and many features I am still discovering after 6 months) The zoom is AMAZING ! I totally recommend this camera to an amateur like me who is looking for a lot of camera for a reasonable price. The attached pictures show the tree where the eagle was sitting across the river ( sorry it is sideways) and the eagle zoomed in without the use of a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera that works even in difficult conditions
customer_reviews.text: I first used the camera extensively on a trip to Costa Rica. It was raining most of the time and daylight was dim, especially in the forest. I had to use ISO800 for most of the shots, and had to focus through the rain. Although the camera was slow to aim and focus compared to a dslr, it was completely usable for bird photography, producing good quality images of far away static objects. Understanding the limitations of the small sensor size, which is what makes the superzoom possible in such a compact package, the only improvement I would have loved is a truly manual manual focus, instead of the slow-acting button.
customer_reviews.author: weltwind

customer_reviews.title: Super Zoom makes it worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: The zoom is great, and is the reason why I purchased this camera. I have many Nikon dslr cameras and lens and even my 200-500 vr can't quite reach where I want it to go. This lens is great for wildlife and bird photography. I've goten great pictures of the moon with other cameras, but usually with a tripod and a big lens. This camera is great hand held for some very detailed moon pics. The only 2 downfalls IMO is the low light focus, and zooming on something closer than 15 feet. It doesn't do well at night using the zoom. Overall, it is a great travel camera and for capturing wildlife.
customer_reviews.author: eppelsauce

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for travel/nature use but What is the deal with the lens cap holder
customer_reviews.text: I used a NIKON Coolpix P550 for more than six years with great satisfaction. After years of heavy use, I recently bought a P900. I noticed that Nikon did not include the useful lens cap holder on the lens cap. There is no useful hole on the cap for a connection. is this a design flaw or they have some other intention. I have found my solution by drilling a 1 mm diameter hole on the cap at a ptoper angled location. This solves the problem rather than purchasing separate a glue-on cap holder.I attached a close-up photo. Great camera !
customer_reviews.author: engineer

customer_reviews.title: Owned for 2 years and still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this camera for two years and absolutely love it. I mostly use it to shoot wildlife but it is versatile enough to shoot landscapes, family events, and is a great travel camera. I recommend carrying an extra battery, as the camera having to zoom in and out with such a large lens is taxing on the battery. Pros: -Zoom! The 2000mm lens is no joke. -Low light shooting is solid, especially for the money -Video stabilization Cons: -No option to shoot RAW -Viewfinder is not as clear as it could be no matter what focus setting I use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It's unique and well worth the asking price.
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I would have a use for another point & shoot camera until I checked out the incredible zoom capabilities of this Nikon P900 and the quality of the photos. I needed a long reach zoom camera to use beside my Astrology Binoculars when viewing the moon, or Jupiter and it's moons, etc, and this inexpensive camera is exactly what I wanted for taking pics of airplanes or other photo opportunities that are just too far away for most cameras. I highly recommend this camera simply because it's zoom capabilities are unique, the camera is in a class all by itself, the photo quality is very good, and the camera is amazingly affordable for what you are getting.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Careful
customer_reviews.text: to start with......the camera is GREAT ! This was a replacemet for one I bought several years ago. The problem was........Amazon sent me an open box item. (ordered a new US vesion) Camera box had been opened and the accessories were just laying in the box. Registration papers were also missing. Returned it to Amazon for a replacement. Replacement (perfect) came within a week.......... The first camera was shipped from Amazon LLC and the second camera was shipped from Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Nine Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Nikon COOLPIX P900 Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: This was the first one I tried before finally sticking to the Panasonic FZ2500. I like the optical zoom but the images were not sharp as the zoom progress. I did not find the zoom capability of this camera would help me taking family pics but for taking pictures for objects at far distance, this could be a very good choice. The low light quality was actually better than Panasonic FZ1000. If this camera had higher MPs, It would have made a big difference. For the price you pay, this is not a bad deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mr ZAKS

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing camera !
customer_reviews.text: I have been testing this camera all week and would recommend it to anyone interested in telephoto photography. It is truly quite amazing. I have been doing serious photography since 1960 and I find the P900 to be quite amazing at a very affordable price. The close photo of Crater Copernicus is a crop of the wider view.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ultra long szoom. Not great at action and low light shots.
customer_reviews.text: Good: Loved the fact that it can take pictures as far as the eye can see, literally! Took it along on safari and was rewarded many many times. Pix of the moon with or without a tripod, brilliant. Bad: Low light pictures are shadowed, in some cases grainy (yes, I know it's a long zoom and will have issues, I didn't expect it to be this bad). Flash lags so bad it's useless, low range. Action shots pass this camera by unless you're lucky enough to be anticipating shots in action mode. Returned it. Planning to buy the 18-300 Nikon lens for my DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Eastern Snowboarder

customer_reviews.title: Amazing zoom!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Optical zoom on this camera. At full zoom, you will want to have the camera stabilized with a tripod because it is very difficult to stay in view strictly being hand held. I wish the lens cap had a tether hole on it though.
customer_reviews.author: G. T.

customer_reviews.title: So far I like this camera a lot
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this camera a lot, but not love it. I have to get more experience with it as so far I'm about 3000 pictures in. Unfortunately any auto or presets just can't get the exposure of even my phone but I kinda new that would be the case. I won't knock the camera for my lack of experience. The zoom is insane and worth the price of admission. Compared to any SLR and 600+ mm lens you just can't get the shots for the money that this camera provides.
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoPete

customer_reviews.title: Get a beautiful, comfortable neck strap!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my! My third Nikon coolpix camera. They grew with each new purchase. This is by far the best, biggest and most special! The Z.O.O.M.! No need for extra lenses to get that moon! It wouldn’t fit into the lens anyway! Shoot with the camera adjusting everything or shoot manually. Easy for me to learn since it’s the only style I’ve ever learned on. Amazing bird and wildlife shots! Close up or far away, it’s all I could ask for. My extra purchase was a glass lens cover to protect and not have to remove and a new neck soft neck strap. The camera is heavy with the huge zoom!
customer_reviews.author: Java Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: The camera is amazing and zoom range is incredible! Still learning some of the features and can't wait for spring to get out in the woods for some great subject material. Will be travelling on vacation and trips this year so I hope to get a lot of great shots. Took some shots of the recent snow moon with my tripod with extended zoom all the way out. I like the scenery mode feature for these shots as it provides a 2 second delay after you trip the button so there is no motion. I just ordered & received a book from Amazon specifically for the P900 that explains the many functions and provides settings and explanations for newer users.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L.

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a real beauty of a camera. I've had Canons and Fuji Finepix versions in the past, but this camera takes excellent photos at up to 2000mm. If I brace the unit well at higher magnification it is fine. I shoot a lot of wildlife here in the wilds of Montana and the West. Clarity is very good, but it seems that the shutter lag is a bit long. Perhaps I need advice on how to overcome that. I'm always learning and open to suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: Ralphie Boyo

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. We have been able to capture great shots at long distances. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is that the instruction manual lacks detail. I had to buy another book to learn how to perform certain functions.
customer_reviews.author: Lori J. Horst

customer_reviews.title: A truly amazing camera with awesome zooming capabilities
customer_reviews.text: A truly amazing camera with awesome zooming capabilities. While the camera is not as well situated for taking pictures with low lighting, I think it is somewhat of niche camera for particular needs but still performs like a good quality dslr. As with many aspects of photography, most troubles with picture taking stem from the user knowing how to take a good shot. This camera is also very well made and does not feel cheap whatsoever. A perfect camera for the amateur photographer trying to improve their skills.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Great for birding!
customer_reviews.text: I received one of these for Christmas and I am having a lot of fun with it. I am a birder, not a photographer, and this camera fits the bill nicely. Pros: With the incredible zoom, I am able to frame birds nicely. I am very satisfied with the image quality of the photos, even at max zoom and handheld. Cons: Autofocus doesn't work very well in low light. I tried taking some photos at daybreak on a cloudy morning and everything turned out blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron H.

customer_reviews.title: Birdwatcher's Dream
customer_reviews.text: For those who do not want to lug around a DSLR with a zillion lenses, this camera does wonders catching clear pictures of far away birds. It has taken incredible pictures for me on birding trips without having to carry lenses that look like they would take clear pictures of nearby planets.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bish

customer_reviews.title: The zoom is quite good !
customer_reviews.text: I just received this camera today and am quite satisfied with the results so far. I live in the country and needed a camera that would reach out for deer and the wildlife. My sample here is just at part of the optical zoom. I have to attach it to my tripod for full zoom. These were taken hand held, Zoom and no zoom. The water in one is just a spot where the cows are standing.
customer_reviews.author: G. F. T.

customer_reviews.title: Zoom. zoom!
customer_reviews.text: I use DSLR cameras (also Nikon) but wanted something lighter, quicker, more casual for fun photography. This camera meets all of those criterion for me. The zoom is ridiculous! 83x - unheard of. Easy to focus, many scenes and settings to play around with, lighter than I thought it would be, good colors. My only negative so far (I've had it a few weeks) - it seems slow to focus on movement. So anything that's sitting still is 100% in focus and sharp, but anything in motion has a tendency to blur. I'm hoping that some of that could be due to my inexperience with this camera. I still gave it a 5 star rating. The zoom is a 10!
customer_reviews.author: connelly

customer_reviews.title: I'm just an amateur photographer but it seems to work great for me.
customer_reviews.text: This picture was taken from about 500 yards away on a cloudy and rainy day. I've only had the camera about a week so I haven't had a chance to take that many pictures with it but the ones I have taken turn out great and the zoom is incredible. I'm very happy with this purchase, now I just have to get some better weather to take some good pictures! Lol. I did end up purchasing a 60 inch tripod after getting this camera because I figured it would help with any long distance pictures that I try to take.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for the price. The zoom is fantastic and this is a great camera. The hand hold has a very deep finger grip so it stays secure in your hand. It is easy to operate and function. I have had this for a couple weeks now and really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Butterworth

customer_reviews.title: The Coolpix900 is a fabulous camera, bit it has limitations.
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding camera for daylight work outdoors. The zoom is fabulous. I don't know of anything else out there like for anywhere near this price. It's produces highly sharp images at incredible distances. But like all cameras, it is not perfect. The Sony RX10 has better color quality and works far in low light or indoors at night. But this camera is great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Frank N. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I really do enjoy using this camera. Couple things to note... this camera is big! It does not fit in any of my camera bags. I’ve had difficulty finding one I like for it. The camera is a bit heavy on the wrist too when taking photos for a long periods. I have had no problems with it! Works great! It took amazing photos of the moon!
customer_reviews.author: Puddles

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera to take on trips
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera to take on trips. It isn't a super expensive DSLR but photos are clear and sharp. Great for taking moon photos. It just rode in my bag on my motorcycle for a 9000 mile trip to Alaska and back and it still works great. Zoom allows you to get those far off bears and moose photos you can't get without buying a very expensive lens. This moose was about 400 yards away and didn't even know I was taking his photo. Stock the battery can only be charged in the camera. I bought back ups with a plug in charger. GPS feature helps me remember just where I took those pictures.
customer_reviews.author: JEH

customer_reviews.title: Not nimble, but a solid all around choice
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared, this camera is heavy. If you want exceptional reach and pretty nice image quality, however, there are not many choices. If you are shooting at max zoom, you will need a rest of some type to get the shot you want. I find it impossible to hand-hold at max zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Michael 2131

customer_reviews.title: Handheld Zoom is Remarkable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for about 8 months and am very happy with it. I find it to work better than my other current and previous cameras in low light, and I find the controls to be intuitive. On a tripod it focuses very well at maximum zoom, and it still works great when handheld. I took the two photos that accompany this review through the window of my apartment while hand holding the camera. Hard to complain with these results.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and excellent lens for normal use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to use for photographing my daughter's volleyball games, but found that it didn't handle the motion and low light any better than my iPhone does. (of course that could have been my fault, too) BUT...for normal photography...this lens was incredible! And the zoom is ridiculous. I mean...it's like a telescope. It's nuts. The lens is great if you have long-distance photographic needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Canon
customer_reviews.text: There is no audio input for a mic. When using the viewfinder display and the camera is tilted at a certain angle it goes off but will still take an image. If you break the lens and need it fixed, Nikon will tell you it takes 14 business days but in reality it will take over a month and half because of the wait for lens parts at the repair shop. If you are a photographer and rely on your camera do not get this one because you may be stranded with no camera for almost two months if it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda J. Staudenmaier

customer_reviews.title: This is not a camera for close ups! If you are trying to capture birds or the moon this IS what you’re looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I really did like this camera. It’s a great price for what it does. Unfortunately I didn’t know enough about cameras when I purchased this one and I had to return it. In my opinion this camera is for outdoor use. The photos I took indoors did not come out as I had hoped they would. If you’re planning on taking an abundance of family photos this is not the camera for you.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Really fun! Never miss shots due to lens changes again
customer_reviews.text: Really fun! Never miss shots due to lens changes again! Images are great in bright sunlight, and good on cloudy days. Focusing was fine for my uses, but not as precise as my DSLR (Canon 70D). But, I also take this and leave the 70D at home. Fun, fun, fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fixed lens camera!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely outstanding. Incredible zoom. Fast burst photo more. One of the few cameras I have played with (under $1000) that can take GOOD pictures of the Moon (wide aperture, aperture priority, burst mode, fully zoomed out). If you are looking for a good fixed lens camera, then it is hard to go wrong with this one! One downside: no RAW mode. That is the one thing Nikon needs to fix.... Five stars anyway.
customer_reviews.author: W. Baggette

customer_reviews.title: This camera was an upgrade from a Coolpix L840 and ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera was an upgrade from a Coolpix L840 and was totally worth it. Finding subjects in the viewfinder was definitely faster and easier than using the screen on the back, the focus is much more precise, and there isn't a lag time between pressing the shutter and the camera taking the photo. Because the P900 is heavier, it is easier to hold it still when the lense is zoomed in on a subject or when the video mode is used. But it does wear on the neck with just a neck strap. A shoulder harness solves that minor disadvantage
customer_reviews.author: dbnaples

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a zoom. This camera is awesome for daylight photos close or far.
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a zoom. This camera is awesome for daylight photos close or far. It a bit heavier then I expected but manageable. Only problem I have it shooting pictures at night. The moon! It has a real problem focusing. 4 out of 5 picture are blurry. One is great. Tried it over holidays at night for lights and such and it had the same problem. Now it's my daytime camera.
customer_reviews.author: schwart4

customer_reviews.title: Like everyone else
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else, we bought P900 for its zoom capability with light weight. The picture quality is about the same as current smartphones (2016~2017), just slightly better, but without better post-processing that you see on iPhone or google Pixel. If you enjoy taking pictures of wildlife and don't want to spend >$10k or carry >30lbs of equipment, then this is a must buy.
customer_reviews.author: SZ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera - does a lot
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera - does a lot, without the photographer needing too much time to get up to speed with its great features, including super zoom. The owners manual, however, needs much improvement. I have 20/20 vision, but needed to borrow glasses to read approx. 4 font light gray print on white paper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi Phooey!!
customer_reviews.text: An excellent camera that takes beautiful pictures, however to suggest that it has Wi-Fi capability is seriously misleading. The reality is that it is capable of connecting with only a limited range of cell phones and not at all capable of connecting with lap tops. When inquiries were made with Nikon support the only advice offered was to get another phone. Hardly a helpful suggestion!
customer_reviews.author: Sarasota Reader

customer_reviews.title: Nikon p900
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera. Of course the zoom is incredible. The shutter is fast. It focuses pretty good. Great camera for the price. I bought the book on Amazon for p900 it's a guidebook and it's awesome. The book explains the p900 very well.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald S.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this camera! I was fully prepared to learn as I go, but even though there is so much to learn to use on this camera I was able to take some pretty awesome pictures from day one! Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Carol C.

customer_reviews.title: Best birding camera out!
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best lightweight birding camera out today. If your a nikon shooter, there is nothing to relearn. It has a intervelometer! I hope i spelled that right. Faraway things are brought right up to you, but the brighter the better. Larger than expected due to the 2.8 lensing. As always i spent my own money on things i purchase and review.
customer_reviews.author: KLR650Tagg

customer_reviews.title: We love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: We've taken some amazing photographs, that are detailed, clear and in our opinion professional quality. We like the selection of setting options, along with the ability to enhance/enlarge the picture on the screen/camera.
customer_reviews.author: RCornell

customer_reviews.title: This camera is simply amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! I can't believe the pictures I get with it and I don't have to lug around a bunch of lenses. I took pictures of birds that were constantly flitting around and they are so clear and the detail is incredible. You would never know I was so far away and didn't even use a tripod. Simply amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera. Looks way more complicated than it really ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera . Looks way more complicated than it really is , doesn’t take long at all to get all the functions down and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Croft Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! The zoom lens is amazing, great for wildlife and landscapes. Although it is somewhat heavy when the zoom lens is all the way out, if you have a steady hand, and a good eye for photographing amazing shots, then this is the camera for you. I would recommend this Nikon COOLPIX P900 to everybody. The price is reasonable. On a side note... get some extra batteries and a battery charger.
customer_reviews.author: Marshallgirl

customer_reviews.title: Gave as a gift, very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a Christmas gift for my son who wanted to upgrade his camera. He is very pleased with it and it has taken excellent pictures. He likes the 16 megapixels, the flip out view finder and the zoom action on pictures he has taken. He's still exploring all the features and I know he will use it often with great results.
customer_reviews.author: From sunny tucson

customer_reviews.title: "Best" camera for Africa trip
customer_reviews.text: Took pictures as good as the $2500 cameras when not even better I would not go for the next model up as you cant hold steady past 2000mm zoom anyway & this one is lighter Again best camera ever for an Africa trip I bought several batteries but as it turns out we never ran out during a game drive (we sometimes did 4x game drives a day) I did swap the battery between game drives We took probably close to 4000 pictures with this camera about 2500 in 4 days in the Masai Mara
customer_reviews.author: JORGE

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera for what it is capabale of doing ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera for what it is capabale of doing for the price. It's amazing for taking pictures of wildlife at a distance, which I use it for 99% of the time. It dies not take clear shots up close and lighting can be an issue. The auto-focus can sometimes go nuts because of these two things. But, it does what I need it to do. MyiPhone does great gor other pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall rating reduced because of quirky battery.
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is very good. Four stars. Its battery is quirky. Mine charges only when the camera is plugged in. I bought a spare battery and standalone charger. They work fine, even though they are different brands. But the charger won't charge the Nikon battery that came with the camera. Also, the battery reserve meter doesn't work right. It shows full charge until it's empty; then it shows empty charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 8) is significantly smaller than a nice SLR lens at f/1
customer_reviews.text: Stunning zoom range. But note that the maximum aperture (f/2.8) is significantly smaller than a nice SLR lens at f/1.4, some 70% less light gathering ability, which makes sporty ultra-fast shutter speeds in dim lighting conditions without a flash and cloudy days very difficult. Still, a very nice general purpose camera that can zoom way in and capture unbelievable details on well-lit things.
customer_reviews.author: T-dot

customer_reviews.title: This Camera is Life!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is life! It's the perfect size and the variety of settings can get me through just about any situation. The settings can be a drawback, though. There are so many options, it's hard to know what setting you need and how to get there through the menu. The zoom is amazing, and I bought this in the starter kit which included the case and battery.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera if you want to zoom but don’t want to buy additional lenses. Great for taking bird shots & moon shots.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but only for a short time
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first one and loved it but after a year I couldn’t download all the pictures off the camera. So amazon refunded me and I bought another bc I love the camera so much. But here I am again and the pictures won’t all download at the same time. Looks like I’ll be getting another refund and look for a new camera. Too bad it’s a great lens
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Solar eclipse!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. You can zoom in unbelievably close to objects far away, I have beautiful pictures of the moon and the solar eclipse. I'm still learning how to use it. It seems like it takes a while between pictures depending on the lighting, but you get some really great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Purdy

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera and the fact you can zoom out ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera and the fact you can zoom out 2000 feet! I am still learning the camera but so far love it. The only negative thing I will comment about is the on/off button. It is very small and hard to find sometimes, but that is the only negative issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M. Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Hard working, easy to like camera!
customer_reviews.text: Although it was a bit larger than I expected, it is a GREAT camera for what I needed it to do. A high performer at all levels that I have tried so far. Easy to use immediately. Zoom is as described: really great. I have had many Coolpix Nikons and this won is one of my favorites. I was glad to read reviews to help me decide to go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Karolyn Gephart

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera. I have never really had a professional camera like this before so it took a little time to learn but the pictures come out amazing. I recently got back from exploring Southern Africa and I was getting so many compliments on my pictures. The zoom is incredible. I was able to see the animals from so far away and so clear! Absolutely amazing! The camera is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Kbnow

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this camera, I haven't had a lot of use of it as it has been raining a lot and photos that I have taken with it are of great quality and the zoom is like no other. I am anticipating on getting some great night shots with it soon. I would recommend this camera for all hobbyist photographers, I do love my DSLR for my abilities to have more control. This camera is a great alternative for me to just grab and take on a road trip and have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Bannick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera. Feel ripped off by Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: My stars are for the camera, but I'd give Amazon negative if I could. Amazon featured this particular one as "Amazon's Choice" when they sell the exact same camera with accessories for so much less. EXACT SAME CAMERA. It didn't even come with a SIM card. The camera is amazing, but make sure you look at all the options. "Amazon's Choice" is apparently to rip you off.
customer_reviews.author: LauraJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for three years now and still love it. Love the wonderful close-ups it takes and now easy it is to use, especially on Auto. This has been the perfect camera for me. No regrets on buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for wildlife and birds
customer_reviews.text: Pro: This camera is capable of taking nice photos at amazing distances. Con: Slow zoom and somewhat slow focus -- I wish it had a manual mode for both. Struggles in low light, but so do other similar super-zoom cameras (Canon 60 and 70 HS).
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Love that I have the functionality of numerous lenses in ...
customer_reviews.text: Just as promised! Love that I have the functionality of numerous lenses in one piece of equipment. Still will use my DSLR with multiple lenses - but this is now my "walk around" camera!
customer_reviews.author: CJRivett

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: Astonishing zoom, amazing features. The best part is the new way you will see your world for photo opportunities. A lot of fun. One possible drawback for some is that the camera does best in good light, low light shots are challenging. I will never learn how to really use all the features, there are just too many, but the automated modes will get you great shots, and you can switch to manual modes as your level of competence improves, if you wish.
customer_reviews.author: MARK S ABRAMS

customer_reviews.title: Best Zoom Camera on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional photographer; I just enjoy being in nature and photographing the beauty around me with a minimum amount of equipment. This camera is perfect for what I want. It is essentially a point and shoot with a tremendous number of features and capabilities. The zoom feature is awesome and even at max zoom the pictures come out clear. The only down side of this camera is that it is a little heavier than the other COOLPIX cameras but they also do not have the same zoom capabilities. I would also recommend purchasing Photographer's Guide to the NIKON COOLPIX P900 by Alexander White.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Capizola

customer_reviews.title: zoomed in the desired framing of the moon pushed the shutter release button and the automatic focus kicked in and the results wa
customer_reviews.text: My first shots with the Coolpix P900 was the moon on a clear night. The 83x lens really did the job. I set the self timer on 10 seconds, zoomed in the desired framing of the moon pushed the shutter release button and the automatic focus kicked in and the results was my best moon shot. I carry two cameras, my Nikon P900 and my Nikon D600. Both fit their purpose. Jim Lee Arkansas
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This camera is better than I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: This camera is better than I was expecting. Some of the reviews have indicated problems with spherical aberration or chromatic aberration. I have found no problems. The camera has an amazing telephoto capability and I am very happy with the pictures I have taken. It is a nice complement to my Canon 60D and Tamron 18-400mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: WEA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera and no need to carry around a bunch of lenses.
customer_reviews.text: I after many years switched from Canon to Nikon with this camera purchase. Very happy that I did. Takes great photos.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip E. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: This Camera, the Nikon P900,  is a WINNER!
customer_reviews.text: This camera, the Nikon P900 is a winner - big time. I just took a photo of the full moon over Baltimore (11.13.15) and the folks on my Facebook page loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Simple To Use
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought me this Nikon for my birthday this year, and I am amazed at the picture quality. I am still a beginner, but I am thoroughly enjoying this camera. We took it on vacation last month when we went to Gloucester, Massachusetts and I got some beautiful shots of the ocean.
customer_reviews.author: Transport Girl Hustle

customer_reviews.title: Zoooooommmmm!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Love this camera. Im not a pro, just an average user, and it's not hard to use. What I bought this camera for, you know what, the ZOOM! I can see an old Volkswagen body on the moon! Not really, just kidding. But if there were some smoke signals coming from the moon, I bet you could see them. It's amazing. Get one and find out. Thanks. PS.. I bought refurbished from Beach Camera, saved a lot.
customer_reviews.author: FJC

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I've been interested in this camera for awhile, finally decided to take the plunge. Really glad I did. It's a great all-around camera, you get good resolution even at full zoom. The camera has its own built-in WiFi, so you download photos directly to your smartphone, or use your smartphone as a remote shutter. About the only drawback might be its lack of RAW format.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: the best thing in this camera 83x zoom it is like a telescope
customer_reviews.author: ABDURRAOUF HASSAN ELFANDI

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: I liked my p530 better. It had all I needed and was lighter weight. Zoom was about the same. But they stopped making so I went with the 900. I was not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David Gould

customer_reviews.title: I’m a amateur with professional pictures.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best camera I’ve ever owned. As you can see from the first picture. Started with Kodak then graduated to Nikon. Now I’m a true Nikon owner. I had a canon rebel 5. For a short time and that was the proof in the digital world that Nikons are the best. This 900 is fabulous!!! Check out the moon. That’s our Ca. Moon with all the fires presenting a red moon. Worth ever cent. Got a great deal on amazon. Thank you amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Vern vanpal

customer_reviews.title: I bought this camera for birding and I love it. I hardly use the "birding" preset
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for birding and I love it. I hardly use the "birding" preset. I mainly shoot in "Shutter Speed" setting. Overall it's a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Renaldo

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: Can really see a lot further with this telephone lens. A bit on the heavy side when lens is extended and probably need a tripod to keep it steady. Will come in handy on a safari I'm taking next year.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Davis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE IT !!! need I say more ? ****added note**** the only downfall is if you use the viewfinder often, it gives out within 2 years. Mine just gave out after using this camera daily for events I film. With a huge event (wedding) coming up in 2 weeks I really need this, but I will have to figure out a way around it (sigh)
customer_reviews.author: JellyBeansJungle

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this!!! I was trying to choose between this one and the D7500 for filming my kids at they sports, track, football, baseball. But I didn’t want to carry around a big camera bag or additional lenses. With this camera I can be seated way up in the top of the bleachers and get a wonderfully clear shot or video of my kids’ play or race. The moon pics are awesomeness as well!!
customer_reviews.author: ann j

customer_reviews.title: Camera for sports and birding. . .otherwise. . . .
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for its intended purpose. If you need the zoom range, great. But for 90% of average use, there are cameras with better image quality. Workmanship is excellent. Plastic is thin. Feels like a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Unanimouse

customer_reviews.title: manuel focus don't work photo comes black at replay
customer_reviews.text: everything works accept manuel focus when i take a photo and play it back its all black and won't show anything will check the rest if its the same. auto is fine
customer_reviews.author: ronald james ferreira

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this camera. It's so easy to use and the quality of pictures is excellent. I got it to take pictures from far off of some eagles nesting and it's perfect for this. Also took a pic of the full moon the other night and WOW! See for yourself. And I'm just an amateur photographer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Savage

customer_reviews.title: Beats my $10,000 800mm canon I must admit!
customer_reviews.text: My oh my this was a great purchase. I've got a canon too level slr with an 800mm ($10,000) monster telephoto and this beats it! It really does. I'm so happy with it. Just took shots of the moon, the zoo and a rocket launch and it's fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled to bits!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this camera. I can photograph an ant close up and zoom into the moon, it's amazing. It loses sharpness when in full zoom but as a family camera for photographing family or just life in general, great camera. It's not too heavy, sits nicely in your hand. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Croasdale

customer_reviews.title: Zoom zoom zoom! I love the zoom!
customer_reviews.text: Zoom zoom zoom! I love the zoom! I am totally an amateur and have produced some very good pictures with this camera. Love that I don't have to lug an extra bid lens around.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is everything I expected it to be! Of course I took the popular moon photo when I first received the camera. I'm still learning how to use every feature, but I love the camera and it's quality already. I would add photos but my app isn't letting me!
customer_reviews.author: Jcpenni

customer_reviews.title: Top quality pictures/video. Very easy to use. Zoom is the best I’ve ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t found anything I’ve disliked yet. Still experimenting with the different settings. Takes excellent landscape pictures. I would recommend this camera to anyone. Worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Davidowicz

customer_reviews.title: Extraordinary zoom
customer_reviews.text: Came as expected. Incredible zoom. You can’t change the lense but this lense is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Jose R. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: This camera is amazing, anyone getting this camera will absolutely love the ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing, anyone getting this camera will absolutely love the zoom feature. Call me crazy but i think reality has a set resolution. Because although fully zoomed in photos look good. They're not as crisp and sharp as something up close. Might be the lense, or physics. Regardless this camera is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamama

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: For me is perfect. But I am no photographer. I am in automatic mode all the time and having fun with the amazing zoom.. Looks and feels great and well built..
customer_reviews.author: H.:Ricarsax

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. I took it to Israel and took 100s of great photos. I think some of the lesser quality photos were due to my lack of understanding as I did not have the camera long before I left on the trip to really get to know it.
customer_reviews.author: Kalani

customer_reviews.title: Wasnt what I expected. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have a tripod, forget about using this camera. I tried taking a picture of the moon. At first it came in clear, i was so excited. Once i clicked on the shutter button, it took forever for the picture to snap which in turn made the picture look like nothing but a glare of light
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Want to see the moon super close? Get this camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. My moon pictures are so close to the surface. I am blown away. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: GarageDaydealz

customer_reviews.title: ZOOM ZOOM ZOOM
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing Camera and has far exceeded my expectation. Picture quality is great and clear but it does not shoot Raw but that is fine. Youre still getting a great Camera regardless. ZOOM is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Dokkaso

customer_reviews.title: Say CHEESE!!
customer_reviews.text: I am sooooooooo happy with this camera!! The zoom is incredible! It takes beautiful pictures! Photography is a hobby for me so I didn't need a great big camera with lots of lenses etc, but wanted to be able to zom in on wildlife because that it what I enjoy photographing! Boy does this camera meet my needs!! LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patti Doeden

customer_reviews.title: Did buy it used and am pretty happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Did buy it used and am pretty happy with it. The flip out view finder had a small crack but hasn't interfered in being able to use it. Still learning all the functions so can't comment on that
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: It suddenly stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera a year ago. It's been working perfectly until today. I've been extremely careful with it, and out of nothing it started to sound loudly when zooming. It couldnt have got dirt inside because I always carry it in a camera bag and it haven't hit with anything so far.
customer_reviews.author: Julio A.

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed that it didn’t come with a strap
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that it didn’t come with a strap. When I first took it out of the box, it makes a “cheap plastic squeak” noise. Not sure if it matters, it might be the way it’s made.
customer_reviews.author: Cde

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Truly an amazing camera! Easy to use and edit photos. Takes amazingly clear photos.
customer_reviews.author: G.

product_meta.title: Nikon COOLPIX P900 Digital Camera with 83x Optical Zoom and Built-In Wi-Fi(Black) & Samsung 64GB memory card with Adapter
feature_bullets: 83x Optical Zoom NIKKOR Super ED VR Lens
Up to 100MB/s & 60MB/s read & write speeds respectively; Class 10 UHS 3
High-performance for 4K UHD video recording, high resolution pictures, mobile gaming and music, for use in Smartphones, Drones, Android Tablets, Tablet PCs, Action Cameras, DSLRs and more

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars918 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
